member.name: T:VaultActivity.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:VaultActivity.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:VaultActivity.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:VaultActivity.LegacyFileTransfer
member.summary: A set of functions to add, check-in, check-out and download files using only web service calls. I attempted to keep the function calls similar to the Vault 2013 versions. For example, byte[] parameters are used, even though a Stream is more optimal.
Adds a file using only web service API calls.
member.param: The entire contents of the file. If you work with large files, you may want to modify this to use a Stream instead.

member.summary: Checks-in a file using only web service API calls.
member.param: The entire contents of the file. If you work with large files, you may want to modify this to use a Stream instead.

member.name: M:VaultActivity.LegacyFileTransfer.CheckoutFile(Autodesk.Connectivity.WebServicesTools.WebServiceManager,System.Int64,System.Int64,Autodesk.Connectivity.WebServices.CheckoutFileOptions,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Checks out and optionally downloads a file using only web service API calls.
member.param: If downloadFile is true, this parameter will return the entire contents of the file. If you work with large files, you may want to modify this to use a Stream instead.

member.name: M:VaultActivity.LegacyFileTransfer.DownloadFile(Autodesk.Connectivity.WebServicesTools.WebServiceManager,System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Downloads a file using only web service API calls.
member.param: The entire contents of the file. If you work with large files, you may want to modify this to use a Stream instead.
